channel.title: [TUT]How to get a free domain! .com, .org, etc
channel.description:
Hi everyone, I'm going to teach you how to get a free domain name.
Requirements: IE6+, Valid Credit/Debit/Gift Card (It charges $1 USD to verify the account. Then it gives it back, I think, but hey, it's only 1 dollar compared to like 15. :P
So how do I get a free domain name? You might ask..
Here's how: First, go to [url=http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/officelive/default.aspx]http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/officelive/default.aspx[/url] Sign up for everything, and there you go. Not much of a tutorial eh? Think again :) I'm going to explain the pro's and con's of this.
Pro's: Free Domain, of course :P Free Hosting
Con's: Can't use PHP files Can't host forums, but I will teach you how.
Here's my ghetto way of "hosting" forums through your free domain. Ok, what you do is sign up for a free hosting site, I use ulmb.com Then create your forums.
Make a new html file named smf.html or whatever you want the link to your forums to be.
Paste in this code, it's an Iframe, which means it will open the webpage that you put the link to in the html page you are making. So it totally masks the forum URL.
[code] <html> <title>Title of site</title> <iframe src="URL of Site" name="frame1" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" align="center" height = "2000px" width = "990px"> </iframe> </html> [/code]
There you go, all finished, now create your site, and have fun!

[/quote]I’ve never heard of any hosting company like that :S[/quote]wow wdf, my host is sexy then.

@VorargC wrote:

Hi everyone, I’m going to teach you how to get a free domain name.

Requirements: IE6+, Valid Credit/Debit/Gift Card (It charges $1 USD to verify the account. Then it gives it back, I think, but hey, it’s only 1 dollar compared to like 15.

So how do I get a free domain name? You might ask…

Here’s how:
First, go to http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/officelive/default.aspx
Sign up for everything, and there you go. Not much of a tutorial eh? Think again
I’m going to explain the pro’s and con’s of this.

Pro’s:
Free Domain, of course
Free Hosting

Con’s:
Can’t use PHP files
Can’t host forums, but I will teach you how.

Here’s my ghetto way of “hosting” forums through your free domain.
Ok, what you do is sign up for a free hosting site, I use ulmb.com
Then create your forums.

Make a new html file named smf.html or whatever you want the link to your forums to be.

<html>
<title>Title of site</title>
